attributes.action: Stop the DVLA from selling driver data to private companies
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The DVLA should not be allowed to sell data to companies without first properly validating the claim, which would include a case presented by the company and a case presented by the individual.  I realise that the DVLA is not a court, and may not have the expertise to mediate such a situation, but at the the moment the indiscriminate selling of public data without sufficient merit must be considered a breach of the data protection act, and thus illegal.

reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
